page.title: 09FARMING IN THE AREA
page.content: The area covered by this D-block is chiefly rural and much of it used for farming .Cereal crops are grown mainly on the flatter land by the A.19 and also on the sheltered slopes of the moorland valleys.On the gently sloping sides of these valleys,the land-cover is chiefly grassland and both dairy and meat-producing cattle graze there.Nearer the tops of these valleys the land becomes steeper and there is more rough pasture.Sheep graze here and also on the higher moorland.Some sheep are brought down to the lower land in winter,but many remain on the moors all year round and seek shelter by dry-stone walls or in gullies.Most farmers in the area practise mixed farming having both sheep and cattle and some arable land for crops.
